t: Deuteronomy 33
Moses’ Final Blessing on Israel
This*p is the blessing with which Moses the man of God blessed the people of Israel before his death.
He said, “The*pn Lord*s came from Sinai and*ld dawned from Seir upon us; he*ld shone forth from Mount Paran; he*ln came from the ten thousands of holy ones, with*ld flaming fire at his right hand.
Yes,*ln he loved his people, all*ld his holy ones were in his hand; so*ln they followed in your steps, receiving*ld direction from you,
when*ln Moses commanded us a law, as*ld a possession for the assembly of Jacob.
Thus*ln the Lord*s became king in Jeshurun, when*ld the heads of the people were gathered, all*ld the tribes of Israel together.
“Let*pn Reuben live, and not die, but*ld let his men be few.”
And*p this he said of Judah: “Hear,*pn O Lord,*s the voice of Judah, and*ld bring him in to his people. With*ln your hands contend for him, and*ld be a help against his adversaries.”
And*p of Levi he said, “Give*pn to Levi your Thummim, and*ld your Urim to your godly one, whom*ln you tested at Massah, with*ld whom you quarreled at the waters of Meribah;
who*ln said of his father and mother, ‘I*ld regard them not’; he*ln disowned his brothers and*ld ignored his children. For*ln they observed your word and*ld kept your covenant.
They*ln shall teach Jacob your rules and*ld Israel your law; they*ln shall put incense before you and*ld whole burnt offerings on your altar.
Bless,*ln O Lord,*s his substance, and*ld accept the work of his hands; crush*ln the loins of his adversaries, of*ld those who hate him, that they rise not again.”
Of*p Benjamin he said, “The*pn beloved of the Lord*s dwells in safety. The*ln High God surrounds him all day long, and*ld dwells between his shoulders.”
And*p of Joseph he said, “Blessed*pn by the Lord*s be his land, with*ld the choicest gifts of heaven above, and*ld of the deep that crouches beneath,
with*ln the choicest fruits of the sun and*ld the rich yield of the months,
with*ln the finest produce of the ancient mountains and*ld the abundance of the everlasting hills,
with*ln the best gifts of the earth and its fullness and*ld the favor of him who dwells in the bush. May*ln these rest on the head of Joseph, on*ld the pate of him who is prince among his brothers.

A*ln firstborn bull— he has majesty, and*ld his horns are the horns of a wild ox; with*ln them he shall gore the peoples, all*ld of them, to the ends of the earth; they*ln are the ten thousands of Ephraim, and*ld they are the thousands of Manasseh.”
And*p of Zebulun he said, “Rejoice,*pn Zebulun, in your going out, and*ld Issachar, in your tents.
They*ln shall call peoples to their mountain; there*ld they offer right sacrifices; for*ln they draw from the abundance of the seas and*ld the hidden treasures of the sand.”
And*p of Gad he said, “Blessed*pn be he who enlarges Gad! Gad*ld crouches like a lion; he*ld tears off arm and scalp.

He*ln chose the best of the land for himself, for*ld there a commander’s portion was reserved; and*ln he came with the heads of the people, with*ld Israel he executed the justice of the Lord,*s and*ld his judgments for Israel.”
And*p of Dan he said, “Dan*pn is a lion’s cub that*ld leaps from Bashan.”
And*p of Naphtali he said, “O*pn Naphtali, sated with favor, and*ld full of the blessing of the Lord,*s possess*ld the lake and the south.”
And*p of Asher he said, “Most*pn blessed of sons be Asher; let*ld him be the favorite of his brothers, and*ld let him dip his foot in oil.
Your*ln bars shall be iron and bronze, and*ld as your days, so shall your strength be.
“There*pn is none like God, O Jeshurun, who*ld rides through the heavens to your help, through*ld the skies in his majesty.
The*ln eternal God is your dwelling place, and*ld underneath are the everlasting arms. And*ln he thrust out the enemy before you and*ld said, ‘Destroy.’
So*ln Israel lived in safety, Jacob*ld lived alone, in*ln a land of grain and wine, whose*ld heavens drop down dew.

Happy*ln are you, O Israel! Who is like you, a*ld people saved by the Lord,*s the*ln shield of your help, and*ld the sword of your triumph! Your*ln enemies shall come fawning to you, and*ld you shall tread upon their backs.”
